summary: Artiodactyls are mammals that walk on two of their five toes, usually in the form of hooves. They are related to whales and dolphins, which are also part of this group. These animals are often herbivores, like deer and camels, but some, like pigs, are omnivores, and whales are carnivores. There are about 270 species, and they are important for humans' diet, economy, and culture. Some examples are cows, goats, and hippos.
title: Artiodactyl
